source_sentence: 「時淨飯王復作是言：『我今心願所有四方護世神王，護諸眾生，今為我子，成利益故，恒相佐助。
translation: "King Jōtoku then also said, 'Now, my heart's desire is that all the gods and goddesses protecting the world and protecting sentient beings in the four directions will now assist my son and work for his benefit.

source_sentence: 天上帝釋，千眼天主，舍脂之夫，大力天王，及諸天眾，左右圍遶，願為我子，所有心求，願作佐助。
translation: God Śakra, the Thousand-Eyed God, Śāriputra, the Vairocana King, and the other gods surrounded him, wishing to be my son, and all their intentions were to assist him.

source_sentence: 又世諸神，風神水神、火神地神，四方四維，彼等諸神，皆作佐助。
translation: Also, the gods of the world, the gods of wind and water, the gods of fire and earth, and the gods of the four directions and four dimensions, all of them serve as supporters.

source_sentence: 汝最勝者，無上丈夫，何故棄捨四大天下？
translation: You most excellent one, the supreme man, why did you abandon the four great heavens?

source_sentence: 彼之我子，今捐家出，志慕無上極妙聖果，其所欲求，願速成就阿耨多羅三藐三菩提道，使早證明。』
translation: Now, my son has left home, aspires to the unsurpassed and most noble fruit, and wants to quickly achieve the unsurpassed, correct path of enlightenment, so that he can quickly realize it.'

source_sentence: 其淨飯王，臥於地上，以種種語，呵責乾陟，作如是言：『汝不善馬，從來多種，為我所作，愛樂之事；今日何緣，忽不饒益，如是損害於釋種家？
translation: The Vimalakīrti king lay down on the ground and rebuked Kanchak with various words, saying, 'You're not a good horse; you've done many things for me since then that I've loved; what are the reasons you suddenly didn't give benefit to and hurt the Śākyamuni family in this way today?'

source_sentence: 我之太子，恒常愛汝，與我心合，常作歡喜，汝今如是，汝須覆滅。
translation: 'My crown prince always loved you, was united with my mind, and always rejoiced in you; now, as you are, you must cover up and cease.

source_sentence: 汝可將我向太子處，我共愛子，共行苦行，我今離別所愛子故，命在須臾，不久存活。』
translation: You may take me to the prince's place, for we shared the same beloved son and performed ascetic practices together, and now I've parted with my beloved son, so my life will be short and I won't be alive for a long time.'

source_sentence: 而說偈言：「『乾陟汝馬速疾行，　　將我詣彼還迴返，　　我無子故命難活，　　如重病人不得醫。』
translation: He then spoke a verse, saying, 'Gandhāra, your horse will quickly go, lead me there and return, for my life will be hard to live without a son, like a man who's gravely ill and can't be healed.'

source_sentence: 「時淨飯王說是語已，因愛子故，苦切所逼，臥在於地，作如是等受苦惱事，舉聲大哭，乍撲乍起，言音哽咽。
translation: "After he spoke these words, the king of Jīvaka was overcome by anguish because he loved his son, and he lay down on the ground, doing such painful things as these, raising his voice and wailing, lashing out and rising, and choking on his words.

source_sentence: 「爾時，有一智慧大臣并及國師婆羅門等，見淨飯王，宛轉于地，左倒右扶，心大愁毒，悲苦纏迫，意不暫歡，身心一時生大熱惱。
translation: "At the time, a wise minister and the state preceptor, Brāhmaṇa, and others saw King Jīvaka, who was twisting and turning on the ground, falling to his left and right, overcome with great sorrow and anguish, unable to stop being happy, and suddenly overcome with great anguish in body and mind.

source_sentence: 其等欲開解王意故，故現顏色，自無憂愁，共白王言：『大王！
translation: Desiring to understand the king's thoughts, they appeared in color, were not sad, and said to the king, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 今者宜可捨諸憂愁苦惱，定於自心，須作健想，不應如是悶絕自撲，猶如凡人涕泣流淚。
translation: Now, it's appropriate to abandon all sorrow and suffering, concentrate your mind, and cultivate healthy thoughts; you shouldn't thus despair and beat yourself up, like a mortal weeping and weeping.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great King!

source_sentence: 當知！
translation: should know!

source_sentence: 如昔過去，多有諸王，棄捨王位，如萎華鬘，背而入山。
translation: As in the past, there were many kings who abandoned their thrones like a withered flower garland and carried it into a mountain.

source_sentence: 又復大王，太子悉達宿緣當受如是業報。
translation: Again, great king, this is the kind of karmic retribution that Prince Siddhârtha will surely receive based on his past lives.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 今者應憶往昔阿私陀仙預授其記，白大王言：「彼童子者，不可拘以人天果報，并及轉輪聖王之位，而期待之，使令貪愛暫住於世。」
translation: Now, you should remember that in the past, the sage Ashita gave him a prediction and said to the king, "That boy mustn't be held to the rewards of human beings and gods or to the position of wheel-turning sage king, and he expects them to cause craving to remain in the world for a while."

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 今者若決定欲喚大子還，但勅我等二人令去，當隨王命終不敢違。』
translation: Now, if you're determined to summon the eldest son back, just tell us both to go, and I will follow the king's order; I dare not disobey it.'

source_sentence: 「時淨飯王即報之言：『汝等二人，若知時者，可速疾往至太子邊，若不爾者，我今身命無有吉祥，為諸苦惱之所纏逼。』
translation: "The king then commanded him, 'If you two know the time, you can quickly go to the prince; if not, my life will be inauspicious and I'll be tormented by suffering and distress.'

source_sentence: 是時大臣并及國師婆羅門等，聞淨飯王如是勅已，即共發行，詣太子所，而說偈言：「『太子應受如是業，　　王當念昔私陀言，　　記彼不貪天轉輪，　　寧樂人間五欲樂。』
translation: After hearing this command from King Jīvaka, the ministers, the state preceptor Brāhmaṇa, and others, they all went to the prince in procession and spoke in verse, saying, 'The prince will accept this kind of action, and the king will remember what he once said, remembering that he didn't crave the heavenly wheel of transmigration but would rather enjoy the five human pleasures.'

source_sentence: 「時彼大臣及國師等，說是語已，相與俱行，其馬乾陟，處處聞於如上苦切呵責言已，意甚憂愁，生大熱惱。
translation: "After those ministers and state preceptors said those words, they went with them, and their horses were ridged, and everywhere they heard such bitter and harsh words, their thoughts were deeply distressed, and they became greatly distressed.

source_sentence: 以熱惱故，無暫時歡；心既不歡，即便命盡。
translation: Because of that anguish, they don't rejoice for a moment, and since their minds aren't rejoicing, their lives will end.

source_sentence: 命盡之後，應時上生三十三天。
translation: After their life ends, they should then be born in the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven.

source_sentence: 既生彼天，後知如來得成道已，即從彼天，捨來下生中天竺國於那波城，其城有一婆羅門種，具行六法，即為彼家，而作子息，乃至漸大，至如來邊。
translation: Once he's born in that heaven, he then learns that the Tathāgata has achieved the Way, so he leaves that heaven and is reborn down in the city of Nabha in Central India, where there's a Brahman who practices the six dharmas and becomes a sons and daughters of that family, gradually growing larger and reaching the Tathāgata's goal.

source_sentence: 如來知彼往昔之時作於馬身，命終生天，時佛即說彼馬因緣，既聞法已，漏盡解脫，入般涅槃。
translation: When the Tathāgata knew that they had been born as a horse in the past and had been born in heaven at the end of their lives, the Buddha explained the causes and conditions for that horse, and after hearing the Dharma, they were liberated from the contaminants and entered parinirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 佛本行集經觀諸異道品第二十四
translation: Sutra on the Collection of the Past Activities of the Buddha Contemplates the Twenty-fourth Chapter of Different Paths

source_sentence: 「爾時，太子自手執刀，割於頭髻，剃除鬚髮，身著袈裟，即時無量百千諸天，生大歡喜，遍滿其體，不能自勝，以喜歡心，齊出聲叫，大歌大嘯，弄諸衣裳，口大唱言：『悉達太子！
translation: "At the time, the prince took the knife in his own hand, cut off his hair in the topknot, shaved off his beard, and put on the reddish-brown robes, and immediately, measureless hundreds of thousands of gods became overjoyed and filled their bodies with great joy, unable to overcome themselves, and, with joy and gladness, they all raised their voices, sang and shouted, touched their robes, and sang out loud, saying, 'Prince Siddhârtha!

source_sentence: 今已出家。
translation: "Now, I've left home.

source_sentence: 悉達太子！
translation: Prince Siddhârtha!

source_sentence: 今已出家。
translation: "Now that he's left home, he'll surely attain unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, and all sentient beings who are born in the Dharma after attaining it will be liberated from that Dharma, even those who are subject to suffering and distress and who are separately bound to it.

source_sentence: 其定當得阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，得已一切生法眾生，當得解脫於彼生法，乃至應受苦惱別離諸眾生等，悉得解脫於此繫縛。』
translation: He will surely attain supreme, perfect enlightenment, and after attaining it, all sentient beings who are born in the Dharma will be liberated from that Dharma, even those who are free from sentient beings who should experience suffering and distress will be liberated from this fetter.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，菩薩割髻之處，其後起塔名割髻塔；菩薩身著袈裟之處，後起塔稱受袈裟塔；車匿乾陟，辭別迴還向宮之處，後起塔名車匿乾陟迴還之塔。
translation: "At the time, the pagoda that followed where the bodhisattva had cut off his topknot was called the pagoda that cut off the topknot; the pagoda that followed where the bodhisattva had worn the reddish-brown robes was called the pagoda that received the reddish-brown robes; and the pagoda that followed where Chak na gandhi had parted and returned to the palace was called the pagoda that Chak na gandhi returned to.

source_sentence: 菩薩行路，諦視徐行，有人借問，默然不答。
translation: As the bodhisattva traveled along the road, he watched carefully as he walked slowly, and when someone asked him about it, he remained silent and didn't answer.

source_sentence: 彼等人民，各相語言：『此仙人者，必釋種子。』
translation: Those people each said to one another, 'This sage must be the Śākyamuni seed.'

source_sentence: 因此得名釋迦牟尼。
translation: That's how he got his name, Śākyamuni.

source_sentence: 「爾時，菩薩自心發起如是思惟：『我今既已，捨於王位，捐自眷屬境界國城，不可生悔，此事成已，是滅相法。』
translation: "At the time, the bodhisattva himself mentally aroused this thought, 'Now that I've renounced my position as king and donated my dependents' realm and city, I mustn't become regretful; once this is accomplished, it's the rule of cessation.'

source_sentence: 如是念已，心轉勇猛。
translation: After such a thought, his mind becomes courageous.

source_sentence: 「爾時，菩薩從彼阿尼彌迦聚落，漸漸欲向於毘耶離中，路有一仙人居處，彼舊仙人名跋伽婆(隋言瓦師)。
translation: "It was then that the bodhisattva went from that village of Animika, gradually intending to head for Vaiśālī, when there was an old sage named Bhagavān (Sui word for warrior) living there.

source_sentence: 菩薩入彼仙人處時，光明顯爀，照彼山林，菩薩既除諸瓔珞具，并捨一切迦尸迦衣，直是身威猶尚出光，耀彼山林諸仙人眼。
translation: When the bodhisattva entered that sage's place, his radiance shone brightly, illuminating the mountain grove. After removing his ornaments and disposing of all his kāsikā robes, the bodhisattva's physical appearance still shone brightly, illuminating the eyes of the sages in the mountain grove.

source_sentence: 而有偈說：「『菩薩象王師子行，　　除捨妙衣及瓔珞，　　直著袈裟麁法服，　　身猶威耀彼諸仙。』
translation: There's a verse that says, 'The bodhisattva Elephant King Shizi practices, discarding his fine robes and jewelry and putting on his robe and crude robes, his body still shines brightly in the eyes of the sages there.'

source_sentence: 「時其林內，所有持行婆羅門仙，行住坐臥，或手執持，隨威儀住。
translation: "At the time, all the Brahman-wielding sages in that forest were walking, standing, sitting, and lying down, either holding them in their hands or following their demeanor.

source_sentence: 彼等一切，向菩薩面，起恭敬心，愛樂尊重，或復生疑瞻仰菩薩。
translation: All of them look up to the bodhisattva with respect, delight, and honor, or they might have doubts and look up to the bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 然彼林內，有諸耆舊婆羅門仙，或取華果藥木草根，其餘他行，未集聚者，彼等未見不生疑心，但遠遙聞菩薩之聲，既聞聲已，心驚速疾來還林中本所住處。
translation: Still, when there are elderly Brahmans and sages in that forest who take flowers, fruits, medicinal plants, roots, or other practices that have yet to be gathered, they don't become suspicious before they see them but hear the sound of the bodhisattva from afar.

source_sentence: 應所作者更不復作，應所取者更亦不取，其餘華果及藥草根，設已取者亦悉捨之，但心速欲來菩薩前。
translation: They don't do any more work that should be done, don't take anything that should be taken, and don't abandon all the other flowers and fruits, herbs and roots that they might have taken, but quickly want to come to the bodhisattva with their minds.

source_sentence: 「時彼林內，所有諸鳥，所謂鴻鶴鵝鴨鸚鵡、鸜鵒鴛鴦、命命孔雀，及迦陵伽、俱翅羅等一切諸鳥，彼諸鳥等，見於菩薩入林中已，各各自出和雅之音，作微妙聲。
translation: "At the time, all the birds in that forest, called cranes, geese, ducks, parrots, monkeys, peacocks, life-sucking peacocks, kalaviṅka, kukkuṭapāla, and other birds, each of those birds, when they saw the bodhisattva enter the forest, produced a harmonious sound and made a subtle noise.

source_sentence: 又彼林中，所有虫獸，其等一切，悉捨水草，不食不飲，歡喜來向於菩薩前。
translation: All the insects and animals in that forest abandoned their water and grass, refrained from eating or drinking, and joyfully approached the bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 「是時彼林諸婆羅門，為祭祀故，[(殼-一)/牛]諸牸牛，取於乳汁。
translation: "At the time, the brahmans in that forest, for the sake of sacrifice, [(hull-mon)/cow] took milk from the various female cattle.

source_sentence: 彼等牸牛，雖復捋訖，而其乳汁，猶更如初，自然流下。
translation: Even though they had finished suckling those cows, their milk continued as before and flowed down naturally.

source_sentence: 「時，彼一切諸婆羅門，各相謂言：『曾聞有八婆娑婆天，此人莫非是於其一？』
translation: "At the time, all those brāhmaṇas said to each other, 'I've heard that there are eight Vibhāṣāṣā gods; could this person be one of them?'

source_sentence: 或復有言：『諸婁宿天，此是其一。
translation: Some people also say, 'This is one of the Lohas Regent gods.'

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 自從其來，入此林中，此林放光，皆悉明耀，如日初出照於世間。』
translation: Since then, they've come and entered this forest, and the forest has shone so brightly that it's like the first appearance of the sun shining in the world.'

source_sentence: 而說偈言：「『或八婆娑此是一，　　或二婁宿中一天，　　若不此林何故光，　　譬如世間日初照。』
translation: He then spoke the verse, saying, 'Perhaps this is one of the eight Vātsīs, or one of the two Lohasus, but why wouldn't this forest shine like the first shining of the world's sun?'

source_sentence: 「爾時，彼等諸婆羅門，修習仙法居彼林者，隨林所出供養之具，將如是等諸供養具，請於菩薩，各各一心，齊頂禮足，同共白言：『善來聖者！
translation: "At the time, those Brāhmaṇas who had cultivated the sage teachings and were staying in that forest, followed the offerings that came out of the forest, invited the bodhisattvas to present these offerings to them, each with one mind, bowed their heads at their feet, and said together, 'Good coming, sage!'

source_sentence: 我等諸仙，欲請聖者住於此處，此處所有華果樹林藥草根葉流泉冷水，隨時堪可納受充用。
translation: We sages would like to invite the sage to stay at this place, where flowers, fruits, trees, medicinal plants, roots, leaves, and cold water flowing from a spring can be accepted and used at any time.

source_sentence: 此是古仙之所居處，欲求解脫，易得安心，此處空閑，經行寂靜。』
translation: This is an ancient dwelling place for sages who want to pursue liberation and easily attain peace of mind, a place that's empty and tranquil for sūtra practice.'

source_sentence: 「爾時菩薩以微妙語，辭釆音句，美麗可觀，聲隱隱深，猶如雷鼓，隨所堪受，問訊相詶。
translation: "At the time, the bodhisattva spoke with subtle words, eloquent speech, and beautiful speech, and the sound was as subtle and profound as a thunder drum, and he answered each other's questions as he saw fit.

source_sentence: 是時諸仙眾中有一婆羅門仙，善巧居林苦行之法，彼見菩薩好容儀已，別更告一婆羅門言：『仁者知不？
translation: At the time, there was a Brāhmaṇa among the sages who was skilled in the ascetic practices of the forest, and when he saw the Bodhisattva's fine demeanor, he addressed a separate Brāhmaṇa, saying, 'Do you know, sir?'

source_sentence: 此天童子，洞識人心，善解方便。
translation: This celestial boy has insight into people's minds and understands skillful means.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 凡世間人，各相謂言：「我生諸子，應當養育，諸子長成，則能為我，興立家計，販賣求財，造作生活。
translation: Ordinary people in the world say to each other, "I've given birth to sons that I should nurture, and when they grow up, they'll be able to build a family for me, sell their goods, and make a living.

source_sentence: 我於當時，求智求道，若負他債，悉償令了。」
translation: At the time, I was seeking wisdom and the path, and if I owed a debt to another, I would have paid it in full."

source_sentence: 如是思惟，諸恩愛故，養育諸子。
translation: Thus, he thinks, 'These are the kindnesses that nurture children.'

source_sentence: 此則不然，為他求道，不計自死，不求自利。』
translation: Not so here, seeking the path for others, not counting my own death, and not seeking my own benefit.'

source_sentence: 「時彼眾中，復更別有一婆羅門，告彼已前婆羅門言：『仁者仁者！
translation: "Then, there was another Brāhmaṇa among them who told the previous Brāhmaṇa, 'Sir, sir!

source_sentence: 如是如是，如汝所言。
translation: "So it is, just as you say.

source_sentence: 世間之人不自覺知，不自辨了，常不知足，但言我今須如是辨，明日復須作如是辨，我行法時，猶尚未至。
translation: Worldly people don't know and discern for themselves, and they often don't know enough, saying, 'I must discern in this way now, and I'll discern in this way tomorrow, but I haven't yet arrived when I practice the Dharma.'

source_sentence: 如是一切諸世間人，以迷惑故，既不辨於此世自利，然未來世亦復不得成就諸利。』
translation: Thus, all worldly people, because of their delusion, don't discern their own benefit in this life, but they won't be able to achieve benefits in future lives either."

source_sentence: 「爾時菩薩從兜率天下來之時，入釋種胎，欲受生日。
translation: "When the bodhisattva descended from Tuṣita Heaven, he entered the Buddha's womb and wanted to have his birthday celebrated.

source_sentence: 彼時先於其跋伽婆仙人林中所居之處，自然涌出二金色樹。
translation: At the time, two golden trees naturally sprouted out from the forest where the Bhagavān sage was staying.

source_sentence: 時彼二樹，高峻長大，而彼二樹，當於菩薩出家之夜，忽然沒地，一時不現。
translation: Those two trees were tall and large, but on the night the bodhisattva left home, they suddenly fell to the ground and didn't appear for a while.

source_sentence: 其跋伽婆仙人，見彼二樹同夜沒不現已，心大憂惱，悵怏低頭，思惟念言：『必我衰時，相貌所至，或復更有惡相來耶？』
translation: After he saw those two trees disappear during the same night, the Bhagavān was greatly distressed, looked down in dismay, and thought, 'Could it be that when I'm declining, my appearance will come to pass, or could there be another bad appearance coming?'

source_sentence: 菩薩見彼跋伽仙人如是憂愁低頭悵怏，心不歡樂，漸至彼邊，而白仙言：『尊者！
translation: When the bodhisattva saw that Bhārgava thus depressed, his head bowed in sadness, and his heart unhappy, he gradually reached the other side and said to the sage, 'Venerable!

source_sentence: 何故顏色憂愁，低頭而坐？』
translation: Why do you sit with your head bowed in sadness?'

source_sentence: 「時彼仙人報菩薩言：『天善童子！
translation: "The sage then reported to the bodhisattva, saying, 'Good boy from heaven!

source_sentence: 此我居處，往昔以來，有二金樹，從地涌出，彼樹高峻，嚴麗可觀。
translation: 'At this place where I live, there were two gold trees that used to spring up out of the ground, and they were tall and beautiful.

source_sentence: 我見彼樹，今忽不現，以其沒故，我今憂愁，心意不樂，如是低頭，思惟坐耳。』
translation: I saw that tree, but now it suddenly doesn't appear because it's gone, and now I'm sad and unhappy in thought, thus bowing my head and reflecting on my sitting ears.'

source_sentence: 菩薩即問彼仙人言：『尊者！
translation: The bodhisattva then asked that sage, 'Venerable!

source_sentence: 彼等二樹出來幾時？』
translation: When did those two trees come forth?'

source_sentence: 仙人答言：『到今已來，二十九年。』
translation: The sage answered, 'It's been twenty-nine years since then.'

source_sentence: 菩薩又問：『彼樹滅沒爾來幾時？』
translation: The bodhisattva then asked, 'How long has it been since that tree died down?'

source_sentence: 仙人報言：『昨夜半時，始沒不現。』
translation: The sage replied, 'Last night at midnight, they first disappeared and didn't appear.'

source_sentence: 菩薩即語彼仙人言：『彼二樹者，是我福力果報故生，若我當作轉輪聖王，我於此處，作一善地園林之所；我今既其捨離出家，以是義故，彼樹昨夜，沒而不現。
translation: The bodhisattva then said to the sage, 'Those two trees were born from the results of my merits, and if I were to become a wheel-turning sage king, I would create a garden at this place that would be a good place; now, since I've left home, that tree disappeared last night and didn't appear.'

source_sentence: 以是因緣，尊者！
translation: Because of this, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 勿復自生憂愁。』
translation: Don't again give rise to your own misery.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，菩薩為於彼等一切諸仙，左右圍遶，於前行至彼所居處，隨意遊行，觀看種種坐起安禪苦行精進求道之處。
translation: "At the time, the bodhisattva was surrounded by all those sages, so he went ahead and went to where they were staying and marched around as he pleased, looking at the various places where they sat up, settled down, meditated, and pursued the path with austerity.

source_sentence: 時彼林內，有一仙人，恒修苦行，在菩薩後，隨逐而行。
translation: At the time, there was an immortal in that forest who was always cultivating asceticism and was following along behind the bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 「爾時菩薩入彼林中，至於仙人居坐處已，東西南北，觀看彼中，行住坐臥，苦行居所，欲求彼等最勝處故，問於彼等諸仙人言：『我今始入，求道未久，是故我欲借問諸仙！
translation: "After he reached his sitting place, he looked east and west, north and south, observed his walking, standing, sitting, lying, and ascetic practices in that place, and wanted to find the most excellent place for him, so he asked those sages, "Now, I've just entered, and I haven't been seeking the path for long; therefore, I want to ask the sages!

source_sentence: 唯願如法為我解說。
translation: "Please explain this for me according to the teaching.

source_sentence: 汝此法行，我曾未知。
translation: This is a practice of yours that I never knew before.

source_sentence: 汝等示現，為我宣說，我得聞已，如法奉行。
translation: You showed it to me, explained it for me, and after I heard it, I approved of it according to the teaching.

source_sentence: 此處求利真實行者，如於汝等所有苦行，我亦依行。』
translation: Those of you who truly practice seeking benefit here are like you and your other ascetic practices, and I also rely on them.'

source_sentence: 彼等諸仙答菩薩言：『仁問我等一切苦行及求道法，我等為仁次第解釋。
translation: Those sages answered the bodhisattvas, 'Sir, we've asked you about all our ascetic practices and ways of seeking the path, and we've explained them in order for you.

source_sentence: 凡行苦行，此之眾內，或有食菜，或有食荑，或食尼拘陀樹枝者，或食頭拘羅樹枝者，或食迦尼迦羅枝者，或復止食一樹之枝。
translation: Among those who engage in ascetic practices, there are some who eat vegetables, some who eat catkins, some who eat branches of the nyagrodha tree, some who eat branches of the Śākyamuni tree, or some who eat branches of the Kaniṣkara tree, or some who stop at eating branches of a single tree.

source_sentence: 或食牛糞，或食麻滓雜果藕根，或食雜種諸樹軟枝，或復飲水而用活命。
translation: They may eat cow dung, or they may eat the root of a fruit-root mixed with hemp, or they may eat the tender branches of various trees, or they may drink water and use it to stay alive.

source_sentence: 或如蜣蜋而自活命，或復有如麞鹿食草而以活命。
translation: Sometimes they're like a dung beetle that lives on its own, or sometimes they're like a wild deer that eats grass and lives on.

source_sentence: 或有立地而用稱心，或有坐地而稱消適，或食四口食而活命。
translation: Sometimes a person stands on the ground and uses their mind to praise themselves, or a person sits on the ground and praises their comfort, or they eat four mouthfuls of food and live.

source_sentence: 或復有持麻作衣者，或黑羊毛而作衣者，或草作衣，或以野蠶綿作於衣，或龍鬚草以用作衣，或以莎草持作於衣，或鹿皮作，或以故破皮作衣者，或亂髮作，或毛[毯-炎+旁]作，或以死人幡作於衣，或糞掃衣。
translation: There may be another person who makes a robe from hemp, another person who makes a robe from black wool, another person who makes a robe from grass, another person who makes a robe from silkworm cotton, another person who makes a robe from dragon's beard grass, another person who makes a robe from sedge, another person who makes a robe from deer skin, another person who makes a robe from worn-out skin, another person who makes a robe from tousled hair, another person who makes a robe from hair [blanket-yang+side], another person who makes a robe from a dead man's banner, or another person who makes a robe from excrement.

source_sentence: 或復裸形臥蕀刺上，或臥板上，或臥株上，或臥杵上。
translation: They may also lie naked on a thorn, on a board, on a plant, or on a pounder.

source_sentence: 或復住於尸陀林中，或住蟻垤猶如蛇居，或住露地，或復入水。
translation: They may also live in a cemetery, or in an ant mound like a snake, or on bare ground, or in water.

source_sentence: 或復事火，或逐日轉。
translation: They may also work in a fire, or they may turn from day to day.

source_sentence: 或舉兩手，安然立住，或地蹲坐，或不洗梳，身坌塵土。
translation: Sometimes they raise their hands and stand upright, or they sit down on the ground, or they don't wash or comb their bodies, and their bodies are covered in dust.

source_sentence: 或復[肆-聿+累]髻，或拔頭髮，或拔髭髯。
translation: Sometimes they [ra-u+re] bun, pull their hair out, or pluck their beard.

source_sentence: 然我等輩，以如是行，自住持己，次或觀時，思惟而行。
translation: Still, we as a group thus conduct ourselves, maintaining ourselves, and then sometimes we contemplate and conduct ourselves when we look at them.

source_sentence: 或復願欲求生天上，或復有欲求生人間，以苦行故，然後其身，始得安樂。
translation: Sometimes we may wish to be born up in heaven, or sometimes we may wish to be born here among humans, and it's because of our austerities that we'll be able to make our bodies comfortable.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 求法甚難，要修苦行，以為根本。』
translation: Seeking the Dharma is so difficult that one must cultivate ascetic practices as its root.'

source_sentence: 而說偈言：「『如是修習苦行時，　　自有三十三天報，　　苦行精進後得樂，　　是故苦為諸樂因。』
translation: He spoke the verse, saying, "When you thus cultivate ascetic practices, you'll have the reward of the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven, and you'll attain happiness after making effort in ascetic practices; therefore, suffering is the cause of all happiness."

source_sentence: 「爾時，菩薩雖聞諸仙如是苦行，而眼未見其法極處，心不喜歡，而知此言未是真善，還緩聲報彼仙人言：『我今觀看，汝法雖有，然苦須滅，而後果報，更無所去，唯當生天。
translation: "Although the bodhisattva then heard that the sages were engaged in such ascetic practices, his eyes hadn't seen the limits of their abilities, and his mind didn't like them. Knowing that this talk wasn't really good, he spoke back slowly to the sage, saying, 'Now, as I see it, although your qualities exist, suffering must cease, and then the result will be nothing but birth in the heavens.

source_sentence: 又其一切諸天宮殿，所有果報，是無常法，以行如上少果報故，如是苦行，既須捐捨所愛親族，復去世間一切諸樂，行於苦行遠離諸樂，以求樂故，乃更入於大牢獄中。』
translation: Furthermore, the rewards of all those heavenly palaces and halls are impermanent, and it's because of performing such little rewards as these that one must abandon beloved relatives and all the pleasures of the past and go back to the great prison for the sake of pursuing painful practices and secluding oneself from those pleasures.'

source_sentence: 而說偈言：「『汝捨愛親及世樂，　　行於苦行欲生天，　　雖復謂言此出昇，　　不覺未來還入獄。』
translation: He then spoke the verse, saying, 'You abandoned your beloved family and worldly pleasures to engage in ascetic practices in order to be born in heaven, and even though you say you've risen, you don't realize that you'll go back to prison in the future.'

source_sentence: 「爾時菩薩說此偈已，復作是言：『若當有人為苦逼身，悕求勝處欲生天上，以天中受五欲樂故，不知厭離，於未來世，不免煩惱之所患害。
translation: "After speaking this verse, the bodhisattva then also said, 'Suppose someone is forced by suffering into their body, desiring to be born in a superior place, and because they experience the five pleasures in heaven and don't know how to get rid of them, they won't be spared the trouble and hardship of affliction in future lives.'

source_sentence: 彼等仙人！
translation: Those sages!

source_sentence: 以苦行故，還求大苦，是諸眾生，命終之時，見大怖故，求後好生，以求生故，還復不離於彼無常。
translation: Because of their ascetic practices, they also seek great suffering; when their lives end, these sentient beings see great fear and seek a later good birth, and because they seek birth, they again don't part with that impermanence.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 何處世間，有諸恐怖，還復染著彼之處所，以於此世苦切逼故，求欲生天受於樂故，悕望渴仰，願求生彼，所作未辦，還復墮於無利益處，而亦不求厭離苦行，亦不求離苦身之法，欲覓勝處過天上樂。
translation: "Where are the worlds in which there are terrorists who are still defiled by attachment to places there because they're severely constrained by suffering in this world, long for birth in the heavens and enjoy their pleasures, long for and aspire to be born there, and then fall back into a place of no benefit before accomplishing what they've done, without seeking to part with the practice of suffering or the Dharma of parting with the body of suffering and wanting to find a superior place that surpasses the pleasures of heaven?

source_sentence: 若有智人，離此五欲，漸漸須覓勝上之處，如足步前，以證勝處，更須求過彼最勝處。
translation: If there are wise people who part with these five desires and gradually seek a superior place, like stepping forward with their feet, in order to realize a superior place, then they must seek to surpass that most superior place.

source_sentence: 若其苦身以得法者，此苦身法是名非法。
translation: If he attains the Dharma because of his painful body, then this painful body and Dharma is called non-dharma.

source_sentence: 若苦身故天上得樂，是因行法得於非法。
translation: If the heavenly realm is made pleasant because of a painful body, it's because of the practice of the Dharma that it's not the Dharma.

source_sentence: 但此身動，由心故行，是故應當先調於心，莫苦其身。』
translation: But this body moves because of its activity in the mind; therefore, you should first regulate the mind and not afflict the body.'

source_sentence: 而說偈言：「『此身動時由心轉，　　應先調心莫苦身，　　身如木石無所知，　　何故隨心而困體？』
translation: He then spoke the verse, saying, "When this body moves, it's the mind that's in motion, so you should first tame the mind rather than suffering the body; the body is like wood and stone without knowing, so why is the mind trapped by the body?"

source_sentence: 「爾時菩薩復作是言：『若前所說，因於斷食當得福者，其野獸等應得大福。
translation: "It was then that the bodhisattva again said, 'If the aforementioned were to obtain good fortune as a result of cutting off food, those wild animals and others would obtain great fortune.'

source_sentence: 又復貧人，以其先業果報微淺，不深植故資財乏少，猶如世間無功德人，常求地上一切神祇功德之水，以澡浴身，望應得於如心所願，其事不然。』
translation: Another poor person, because the results of his prior actions are shallow and he doesn't plant deeply, has few assets, just like a person in the world without merit who always seeks the meritorious waters of all the gods on earth to bathe his body, hoping that he'll get what his heart desires, but that's not the case.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，彼諸苦行師等白菩薩言：『明智仁者！
translation: "At the time, those ascetics and others said to the bodhisattva, 'Wise sir!

source_sentence: 仁於此處，見何等患？』
translation: What kind of trouble do you see in this place?'

source_sentence: 菩薩答彼苦行師言：『汝今行此苦行之事，後日還來入此有處。』
translation: The bodhisattva answered that ascetic, 'Now that you've done this ascetic practice, come back to this place of existence some day.'

source_sentence: 其苦行師，復更詳共問菩薩言：『我此處有如是法行。』
translation: The ascetic then asked the bodhisattva in detail, 'This is the kind of practice of the Dharma that exists here.'

source_sentence: 菩薩報言：『云何得知如此苦行還入有處？
translation: The bodhisattva replied, 'How can I know that such ascetic practices will lead me back into the abodes of existence?'

source_sentence: 汝等此行，非究竟入、非無畏處。』
translation: This practice of yours is not a final entry or a fearless place.'

source_sentence: 「時苦行師復更重白於菩薩言：『大德仁者！
translation: "The ascetic then again repeatedly said to the bodhisattva, 'Sir, O great virtuous one!

source_sentence: 唯願仁者莫作如是說。
translation: Please don't make such a claim, sir.

source_sentence: 我今此居，所行道路，是無畏處，有大功德，若人依此道路行者，捨此惡形，得勝妙身。』
translation: Now, I live here, and the path I'm following is a fearless place with great merit, so if someone follows this path, they'll abandon this bad form and attain a marvelous body.'

source_sentence: 「菩薩報言：『雖捨惡形後得妙身，而實未是離有之法。
translation: "The bodhisattva replied, 'Although I might abandon my bad form and then attain a marvelous body, it's really not a dharma free of existence.

source_sentence: 因今苦身，得於後身，然彼後身，亦未離苦。
translation: Because of this painful body, he'll attain a later body, but that later body hasn't yet parted with suffering.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 雖復行於多種苦行，望欲求樂而不離苦。』
translation: Even though they repeatedly engage in many kinds of ascetic practices, they want to pursue happiness but aren't free from suffering.'

source_sentence: 其苦行師，復更執理，白菩薩言：『仁者不然，不以苦行後還得苦，但以我等苦此身故，後世決定得於快樂。』
translation: Again, the ascetic adhered to the principle and said to the bodhisattva, 'Sir, it's not true. It's not because of the ascetic practices that we'll return to suffering, but because we've suffered this body, we'll surely attain happiness in the afterlife.'

source_sentence: 菩薩復答：『如此之言亦是無智。
translation: The bodhisattva then replied, 'Such talk is also witless.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 譬如有人，欲求於利，不知其內而有大失。
translation: It's like a person who wants to get some profit but doesn't know it's inside and has a big loss.

source_sentence: 以知失故，欲求利者，此非智人。』
translation: Someone who wants to seek profit because they know it's a mistake is not a wise person.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，彼有一婆羅門，在於眾中高聲唱言：『希有希有！
translation: "At the time, there was a Brāhmaṇa among the crowd who raised his voice and said, 'Rarely, rarer!

source_sentence: 此之王子，是真實智。
translation: "This, Prince, is true knowledge.

source_sentence: 譬如有人，得美飲食，而和雜毒，誰樂欲噉？
translation: It's like a person who obtains a delicious meal and mixes it with various poisons, but who would like to devour it?

source_sentence: 如是此事，後雖得樂，而未離於有為生老病死之法，此豈非是還求後生？』
translation: Is this not a case of those who, although they may attain happiness later, have not yet parted with the condition of birth, old age, illness, and death, and yet seek afterlife?"

source_sentence: 「爾時菩薩復作是言：『苦苦世間，憎死命鬼，復求後生，此大癡騃。』
translation: "At that point, the bodhisattva again said, 'This is a great folly to suffer in the world, hate death and life as a ghost, and seek afterlife.'

source_sentence: 苦行師言：『善哉王子！
translation: The ascetic teacher said, 'Good, Prince!

source_sentence: 仁慎莫深諦觀此行，此行過去無量大德，共行此行，此之居處，往昔無量諸王仙等，百千萬億，行此苦行，而共求於後世之樂。』
translation: 'You mustn't deeply perceive this practice, which was practiced by measureless great virtues in the past, and which resides in a place where measureless kings and sages of the past, hundreds of thousands of millions of them, performed this painful practice while seeking the happiness of the afterlife together.'

source_sentence: 菩薩又言：『如汝今言千萬歲者，希有大癡！
translation: The bodhisattva then said, 'Such as your claim of a thousand million years, that's a rare and great folly!

source_sentence: 嗚呼妄語！
translation: Woo-hoo, false speech!

source_sentence: 此處大德，以苦行故，分別境界，求後世樂，於未來世，受生死有，不曾知足，於煩惱中，不作所作，展轉其中，以其世間求於樂故，反多得苦。』
translation: Here, great virtuous man, because of ascetic practices, discriminates objects, seeks pleasure in the afterlife, is subject to birth-and-death existence in future lives without ever knowing it, doesn't do anything in the midst of affliction, and goes from one activity to another, and because he seeks pleasure in that world, he instead experiences much suffering.'

source_sentence: 「時，苦行師復作是言：『仁者王子！
translation: "The ascetic then again said, 'Prince of Compassion!

source_sentence: 此境界主，寐(亡私反)洟(陀利反)羅城，其王欲作無遮之會，祭祀諸天，殺害眾生，其數不少，求後受樂。』
translation: The king of this realm, the city of Ṛṣipatana, wants to create an assembly without a stoppage, sacrifice to the gods, and kill a great many sentient beings in order to seek subsequent happiness.'

source_sentence: 菩薩復言：『凡以殺害而得法者，可名行乎？』
translation: The bodhisattva then said, 'Can anyone who kills and injures to obtain the Dharma be called a practitioner?'

source_sentence: 其苦行師，又復白言：『我相承來，祭祀諸天法用如是。』
translation: The ascetic then again said, 'Thus have I inherited the rituals and dharmas for sacrificing to the gods.'

source_sentence: 菩薩報言：『何有苦他名為法也？
translation: The bodhisattva replied, 'What's the other name for suffering?'

source_sentence: 有塵坌身，還將塵拭，能得淨乎？
translation: If you wipe away the dust that has covered your body, how can you be purified?

source_sentence: 有血塗身，還以血洗，豈能得淨？
translation: How can you be purified if you smear your body with blood and then wash it with blood?

source_sentence: 有行非法，當得於法，無有是處。』
translation: 'There's no place for someone who practices what's not the Dharma to attain the Dharma.'

source_sentence: 苦行師言：『實有是處。』
translation: The ascetic teacher said, 'There really is a place.'

source_sentence: 菩薩又言：『有何因緣？』
translation: The bodhisattva also said, 'What are the causes and conditions?'

source_sentence: 苦行師言：『依韋陀論，往仙所說。』
translation: The ascetic teacher said, 'According to the Vedas' treatise, it's taught by past sages.'

source_sentence: 菩薩又言：『此是何義？』
translation: The bodhisattva also said, 'What's the meaning of this?'

source_sentence: 苦行師言：『若有諸人，祭祀諸天，是名為法。』
translation: The ascetic teacher said, 'If people sacrifice to the gods, this is called the Dharma.'

source_sentence: 「菩薩又言：『我且問汝世間近法，若人殺羊，祭祀天已，得如法者，何故不殺所愛親族而祭祀天？
translation: "The bodhisattva also said, 'Let me ask you a question about a recent worldly dharma: If a person slaughters a sheep and sacrifices it to the gods, and it's obtained according to the dharma, why wouldn't they kill their beloved family members and sacrifice them to the gods?'

source_sentence: 是故我知殺羊祭祀，無有功德。
translation: I therefore know that there's no merit in killing a sheep for sacrifice.

source_sentence: 汝行雜法，意欲如是。』
translation: Do you intend to do this by practicing various dharmas?'

source_sentence: 「爾時，菩薩遙見去此坐處不遠，有一叢樹，如尸陀林，菩薩見已，告彼苦行諸師等言：『尊者但看彼地處所，名何苦行？
translation: "At the time, the bodhisattva saw from a distance a grove of trees like the cemetery not far from where he was sitting, and when he saw it, he told the ascetic masters, saying, 'Venerable, just look at that place, what's the name of this ascetic practice?'

source_sentence: 而彼林下，或有死屍，諸鳥所食；或有死屍，白骨而聚，今者現見。
translation: "Underneath that forest, there may be a dead corpse that's eaten by birds, or there may be a dead corpse that's a mass of white bones that's presently visible.

source_sentence: 或有死屍，以火焚燒，成一聚骨；或有死屍，懸著樹上；或有死屍，被其眷屬之所殺害，莊嚴其座，依法而葬，後生慚愧。
translation: Sometimes a dead corpse is burned in a fire and becomes a mass of bones; sometimes a dead corpse hangs from a tree; sometimes a dead corpse is killed by its retinue, adorned in its place, and buried according to the law, resulting in shame later.

source_sentence: 或有死屍，眷屬圍遶，相送來向尸陀林中，安置於地訖還歸舍。』
translation: Sometimes a dead corpse is surrounded by its retinue, escorted to the cemetery, placed on the ground, and returned to the monastery.'

source_sentence: 其苦行師，又復更言：『仁者王子！
translation: The ascetic then went on to say, 'Prince of mercy!

source_sentence: 然其彼處尸陀林者，四輩共同，無有簡選，平等施身，福德之地，名為曠野。
translation: "Still, that place, the cemetery, is a place where the four groups work together, there's no shortage of choices, and the body is given equally, which is a place of merit called the wilderness.

source_sentence: 此處地方，布施身者，不用苦力，速生天上，求世勝處，速得受樂。
translation: At this place, someone who gives generously of themselves will quickly be born up in heaven without suffering, and they'll quickly find happiness in a place of worldly excellence.

source_sentence: 或有仁者，投身絕崖，或燒或施，而生天上。』
translation: Some kind people may plunge into a precipice, burn themselves or give alms, and be born up in the heavens.'

source_sentence: 「菩薩復言：『若當如是修行行者，後求富貴，嗚呼大癡！
translation: "The bodhisattva then said, 'If someone thus cultivates their practice and seeks wealth and prosperity later, woe to them, great fool!

source_sentence: 嗚呼無常！
translation: Ahoy impermanence!

source_sentence: 而求後世，多有怨讎，求後富貴，嗚呼大苦！
translation: Seeking a later life is fraught with grievances, and seeking a later life of wealth and prosperity is a cry of great suffering!

source_sentence: 還求大苦！
translation: to seek in vain for great suffering!

source_sentence: 彼等癡愚，無智之人，入大火聚，入大蛇口。』
translation: Those foolish, unwise people enter a great fiery mass or the mouth of a great serpent.'

source_sentence: 菩薩如是辯才之舌，向諸仙人，說解脫言，作微妙語，如是說時，日將向沒。
translation: With such an eloquent tongue, the bodhisattva spoke words of liberation and made subtle remarks to the sages, and when he spoke in this way, the sun was about to disappear.

source_sentence: 「是時菩薩，還彼仙人所居之處，一夜停宿，後日天曉，更餘處行。
translation: "The bodhisattva then returned to where those sages were staying, stopped for the night, and traveled to another place at sunrise the next day.

source_sentence: 彼等諸仙，隨菩薩後，次第而行。
translation: Those sages followed the bodhisattva and traveled in order.

source_sentence: 「爾時，菩薩少時行已，見彼諸仙隨後而行。
translation: "After walking for a short time, the bodhisattva then saw those sages walking after him.

source_sentence: 菩薩見已，即便依一樹下而坐，彼等諸仙，圍遶菩薩，或坐或立。
translation: After he saw them, the bodhisattva went and sat down under a tree, and those sages surrounded the bodhisattva, either sitting or standing.

source_sentence: 「是時彼諸眾仙之中，最老仙人，向於菩薩，生希有心，而白之言：『仁者王子！
translation: "At the time, the oldest of those sages had a rare feeling about the bodhisattva and said, 'Sir!

source_sentence: 自汝來至我所住處，時彼地方而自莊嚴。
translation: Since you came to my place, that place has adorned itself.

source_sentence: 仁者出已，彼處如今即成曠野，以是義故，唯願仁者！
translation: Now, after you leave, that place will become a wilderness, and for that reason, may it please you!

source_sentence: 莫捨於我所坐之處。
translation: "Don't abandon where you're sitting in my place.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 凡人欲得疾生天上，在此福地而修行者，不久即生，向於天上。
translation: Anyone who wants to be quickly born in the heavens and cultivates his practice in this blessed place will soon be born and head for heaven.

source_sentence: 是故仁者！
translation: Therefore, good man!

source_sentence: 不應捨此如是微妙先聖所行清淨之所而行餘處。』
translation: You shouldn't abandon this pure place where such subtle sages used to practice and go to another place.'

source_sentence: 而說偈言：「『仁來我林威德嚴，　　今去忽然成曠野，　　是故不應相棄背，　　如人愛命莫捨身。』
translation: He spoke the verse, saying, 'Sir, I've come from this forest of imposing virtue, but now I've suddenly left it in the wilderness; therefore, I shouldn't abandon it, just as someone who loves life shouldn't abandon his body.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，諸仙說是偈已，即更白言：『仁者王子！
translation: "After the sages spoke this verse, they then added, 'Sir, Prince!

source_sentence: 今在此處，得不見於無有恩義鄙惡人乎？
translation: Now, can you not see a graceless, mean, and unrighteous person here?

source_sentence: 或見墮於雜行之人，或復見於不淨行人？
translation: Perhaps you see someone who has fallen into various practices, or perhaps you see an impure practitioner?

source_sentence: 若不如是，仁者何故不樂於我所居停處？
translation: If that's not the case, then why wouldn't you be happy where I live and rest?

source_sentence: 我等諸仙，欲隨仁者作於善友，隨順不逆，奉教隨行，欲共仁者求勝妙處，假使歲星共仁者居，猶得勝處，何況我等苦行諸仙。』
translation: We sages want to follow you, Sir, as a good friend, to be obedient and not disobedient, to follow the teaching, and to seek superior and marvelous places together with you, for even if the stars of the year lived with you, they would still be able to find a superior place, let alone us ascetic sages.'

source_sentence: 「爾時菩薩，得彼諸仙上首請欲同求解脫，見其意已，即說自心本所誓願，兼復讚歎彼等苦行一切諸仙，而語之言：『仁者諸仙！
translation: "After the bodhisattva was invited by those ascetics to head up and seek liberation with them, he saw their intention and explained his heart's original vow and praised all those ascetics, saying, 'Sages, you!'

source_sentence: 今者已得無礙之辯，而身久來習行如法，內心淨故，能於未曾所識人邊，生大慇重敬念之心。
translation: Now, having attained unhindered eloquence, he has long practiced according to the Dharma and has a pure inner mind, so he can give rise to great respect and veneration for people he's never known before.

source_sentence: 今若欲捨，猶如親愛，乃生大愁。
translation: If he wants to abandon them now, he's like an intimate friend, which gives rise to great sorrow.

source_sentence: 其事雖然，但仁者輩所求之法，為生天果，我不然也。
translation: Although this is true, the way those good people seek is to be born in the fruit of heaven, but not I.

source_sentence: 我今乃欲志求解脫，不欲取有。
translation: Now, I want to aspire to liberation, not to acquire existence.

source_sentence: 我之意願，決定如是。
translation: My intention is definitely this.

source_sentence: 我心既觀如是相已，見於汝等所居之處，心不願樂，一欲求還，一欲求去，此二甚遠。
translation: After observing these characteristics, my mind sees that where you live, my heart doesn't want to be happy, and one wants to return, and the other wants to leave, which are both very far away.

source_sentence: 然我亦非不樂此處，又亦不復憎疾他人，亦非見於他人過咎，而不住此捨背行也。
translation: Still, I don't dislike this place, hate others, and don't see the faults of others and refrain from this renunciant practice.

source_sentence: 然汝等輩！
translation: Still, you people!

source_sentence: 皆住於法，隨昔仙聖有所言說，汝等一切，皆悉已得大仙之法。』
translation: They all abide in the Dharma, and according to the words of the sages of yore, all of you have attained the great sage's teaching.'

source_sentence: 是時彼等諸仙人，見菩薩所求解脫勝上，於菩薩所更生慇重愛敬心想。
translation: Seeing the bodhisattva's quest for liberation as superior, those sages cultivated respect and admiration for the bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 「爾時，彼眾其中有一梵志仙人，恒臥灰中，或編椽上，身著死屍，糞掃衣服，耳目青黃，鼻長身白，手執軍持。
translation: "It was then that one of those sages, a priest, was always lying in the ashes or woven up in the rafters, wearing a corpse, wearing robes made of dung, with blue and yellow ears and eyes, a long nose, and a white body, and holding an army in his hand.

source_sentence: 聞菩薩說如是語已，向菩薩面，歡喜以報歎菩薩言：『仁者所語，極大微妙，最上誓願。
translation: After hearing the words of the bodhisattva, he turned to him, rejoiced, and praised him, saying, 'Your words are extremely subtle and sublime, and they are the highest vow.

source_sentence: 汝今乃能年少之時，未受五欲，見諸過患，若不渴仰欲生天者，豈能得知天上後患，如是觀已而求解脫，彼人不久，便得解脫。
translation: Now, when you were so young and hadn't yet experienced the five desires and seen the faults, how could you have known about the subsequent troubles in heaven if you hadn't longed to be born in heaven and sought liberation after thus observing them?

source_sentence: 若當仁者，有如是意，決定欲求彼解脫者，汝今宜應速疾而行。
translation: If you, sir, have such an intention and are determined to pursue his liberation, you should act quickly now.

source_sentence: 去此不遠，有一仙人住止之所，名日穿藏，彼有一仙，名阿羅邏，彼仙已得決定正智清淨之眼。
translation: Not far from here, there's an sage who lives and stays there, named Sun Penetration Canon, and there's an sage named Ararāḍa who has attained the clear eye of definitive right knowledge.

source_sentence: 仁者可至彼邊諮問，應聞至真方便行路。
translation: You may go there and inquire about it, and you should hear about the path of skillful means to attain the truth.

source_sentence: 仁者若聞此之方便，必至彼真，如我意觀仁者所見，必過於彼。
translation: If you hear about this method, you'll surely reach the truth there, just as I think you'll see something that's beyond that.

source_sentence: 如今仁者，心想及身，一切相貌，決定當度諸智彼岸，勝於往昔諸仙人等未曾證者，今悉得之。』
translation: Now, you, sir, with your mind, thoughts, body, and all appearances, will surely cross over to the other side of cognition, surpassing those sages and others of the past who have never realized it before and have now attained it all.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，菩薩報彼梵志仙人等言：『願如仁者所述可也。』
translation: "At that point, the bodhisattva reported to those Brahmā sages and others, saying, 'May it be as you've said, sir.'

source_sentence: 「是時菩薩捨彼仙人慇懃勸請，背之而行，意欲向於阿羅邏所。
translation: "Then the bodhisattva ignored the encouragement of those sages, turned his back on them, and departed, intending to go to the Ārāḍa.

source_sentence: 而有偈說：「『摩訶釋種聖王子，　　善巧美語慰諸仙，　　決欲前向羅邏邊，　　所有諸仙還自住。』
translation: A verse then said, 'The noble prince Mahāśāsaka, who spoke skillfully and beautifully to comfort the sages, decided to go to the edge of the Ārāḍa, and all the sages returned to their own abodes.'

source_sentence: 佛本行集經王使往還品第二十五上
translation: Sutra on the Collection of the Past Activities of the Buddha, Chapter 25 on the Return of the King's Ambassadors

source_sentence: 「爾時，國師大婆羅門及一大臣，二人齊共受淨飯王悲哀瀝淚啼號勅已，即便整備賢善好車駕馭而立，奉承大王威德勢力，從所住城迦毘羅出，出已尋逐菩薩脚跡，速疾而行，漸漸至於彼跋伽婆仙人住處。
translation: "At the time, the king's teacher, the great brāhmaṇa, and a minister, both of whom had been commanded by King Jīvaka to weep and wail in pity, prepared a good and noble chariot, drove it to stand, and in deference to the great king's authority and might, left Kapila, the city where they were staying.

source_sentence: 其跋伽婆，遙見使來漸將向近，即起前迎，而口唱言：『善來仁者！
translation: When he saw the messenger approaching, he rose to meet him and said, 'Well come, sir!'

source_sentence: 云何忽屈來到此間？
translation: How did you suddenly come to this place?

source_sentence: 願且消息，少時停止，此草鋪上解歇暫坐，我當具辦甘果冷水，隨意飲食。』
translation: May I take it that you stop for a short while and rest here on this grassy bunk, where I will prepare sweet fruit and cold water and eat as I like.'

source_sentence: 時二使人，即便頂禮彼跋伽婆仙人之足，禮已却退坐於一面，坐安隱已，其跋伽婆，種種慰勞王二使人。
translation: The two ambassadors then bowed their heads at the feet of that sage Bhagavān, withdrew to one side after paying homage, and after they had sat down peacefully, the Bhagavān variously comforted the king's two ambassadors.

source_sentence: 「爾時，大臣即便逆止跋伽婆，語而問之言：『大仙尊師！
translation: "At that point, the minister even stopped the Bhagavān and asked him, 'Venerable teacher, great sage!

source_sentence: 我等今被彼甘蔗種大淨飯王勅命而來，我身即是彼王大臣。』
translation: Now, we've been ordered to come by that great pure-rice king of the sugarcane plant, and I myself am his minister.'

source_sentence: 指國師示：『此是彼王國之尊師大婆羅門。
translation: Pointing to the national teacher, he said, 'This is the venerable teacher of that kingdom, the great brāhmaṇa.

source_sentence: 彼甘蔗王，有一太子，字悉達多。
translation: That sugarcane king had a prince named Siddhârtha.

source_sentence: 以畏生老病死之故，欲求解脫，捨宮入山，傳聞道其已至此處，我等求彼故來至此。』
translation: Fearing birth, old age, illness, and death, he wanted to seek liberation, so he left his palace and went into the mountains. It was rumored that he had arrived here, so we sought him out and came here.'

source_sentence: 作是語已，跋伽婆仙即便報彼二使人言：『實有此事，然其脩臂功德具足勝上丈夫，曾至此處，至此處已，而問於我所修行法，我依實說，彼既知已即云：「此雖勝於人間，其後還來入生死中，非是究竟解脫之處。」
translation: After saying this, the sage Bhagavān even reported to those two messengers, saying, 'It's true, but that man with the perfect armor and the perfect virtue had been here before, and after he arrived here, he asked me about the things he was practicing, and I told him the truth.

source_sentence: 嫌故捨去，欲求出離解脫生死，今者進向於阿羅邏仙人居所。』
translation: He therefore rejects it and wants to escape and be liberated from birth-and-death, so now he's headed for the abode of the sage Ārāḍa.'

source_sentence: 而說偈言：「『脩臂丈夫功德具，　　至此聞我法非真，　　欲求至極大涅槃，　　背我今向阿藍所。』
translation: He then spoke the verse, saying, 'The virtues of a man with noble arms are fully present, so he's heard that my teaching isn't true, and he wants to pursue the ultimate great nirvāṇa, so he's turned his back on me and headed for the Ārāḍa's abode.'

source_sentence: 「爾時二使，大臣、國師婆羅門等，聞跋伽婆仙人語已，以至孝心於淨飯王慇重敬故，不覺疲乏，無有懈勌，不食甘果，不飲水漿，依跋伽婆仙人之語，即共相尋向菩薩所。
translation: "After hearing what the sage Bhagavān said, those two envoys, the minister and the state preceptor Brāhmaṇa, and others paid respect to King Śuddhodana with such filial piety that they didn't become weary and had no laziness, stopped eating sweet fruit and stopped drinking water and milk, and, relying on what the sage Bhagavān said, they all headed for the bodhisattva's place.

source_sentence: 彼等漸至到菩薩邊，遙見菩薩在於林中，於一樹下，鋪草而坐，除其一切諸寶瓔珞，身體放光，巍巍顯爀，而自莊嚴。
translation: As they gradually reached the bodhisattva, they saw him from a distance sitting under a tree in a forest, spread out on grass, removed all his jewelry, and adorned himself with a body that glowed and shone brightly.

source_sentence: 譬重雲中，忽然日出，照耀天下，滿林樹間。
translation: It's like a sudden sunrise amidst heavy clouds that shines brightly throughout the world and fills the forest among the trees.

source_sentence: 見已相與從車而下，安庠徒步，向菩薩邊，至已頂禮於菩薩足，口同唱言：『唯願聖子！
translation: After they see this, they all disembark from the chariot, walk calmly on foot, head over to the bodhisattva, bow at his feet as they arrive, and chant with one voice, 'May it be, noble son!'

source_sentence: 一切常勝。』
translation: All things are always superior.'

source_sentence: 更自前立，近菩薩邊。
translation: Again, he stood up close to the bodhisattvas.

source_sentence: 「爾時菩薩慰勞彼等，隨於彼等所能堪受，勞謝語言而慰問已。
translation: "The bodhisattva then reassured them, thanking them as they were able, and spoke words of reassurance to them.

source_sentence: 菩薩命令相近而坐，二使坐已，白菩薩言：『大智太子！
translation: After the bodhisattva ordered them to sit close together, the two messengers said to the bodhisattva, 'Prince Mahākauṣṭhila!

source_sentence: 聖子之父，淨飯大王，以心愛敬於聖子故，大受苦惱。
translation: The father of the noble Son, the great king of pure rice, greatly suffers because his heart loves and respects the noble Son.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 當於聖子出宮之日，大王聞已，立地自撲，迷悶而絕，全不覺醒，以水灑噴，良久乃穌。
translation: On the day the noble son left the palace, the king heard about it, stood up and threw himself to the ground, became confused and desperate, and didn't wake up at all.

source_sentence: 既復本心，流淚滿面，憶念聖子，其狀如是。
translation: Once he had returned to his original mind, his face was filled with tears as he remembered the noble Son in this way.

source_sentence: 今遣我等，來聖子邊，唯願聖子！
translation: Now, we've been sent here to the Son's side, so may the Son!

source_sentence: 正心專聽王如是勅：「我以知汝正意樂法，我以知汝不住我宮，必應出家求無上道。
translation: With correct concentration, he listened to the king's command, "I know that you have the right intention and desire for the Dharma, and I know that you won't stay in my palace and will leave home and pursue the unsurpassed path.

source_sentence: 其理雖然，但今非是汝入山時。
translation: Although that's true, now is not the time for you to enter the mountain.

source_sentence: 我既見汝非時入山，是故我今憂愁苦毒，全身被然，猶如猛火焚燒大林。
translation: Since I saw that you didn't enter the mountain at the right time, my whole body is tormented by grief and pain, just like a fierce fire burning down a great forest.

source_sentence: 汝今且可割意，還來入於我宮，暫捨於汝愛法之心，受我愛重。
translation: Now, you might cut yourself off and come back to my palace, abandoning your love of the Dharma for a moment and accepting my esteem.

source_sentence: 若如此者，是汝法行。
translation: If you do so, this is your practice of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 若汝不還至我目下，今我受苦如是增長。
translation: If you hadn't returned to my eyes, my suffering would have grown like this.

source_sentence: 譬如大河，長遠流注，於一時頃，兩岸崩頹，其水被填，忽然斷絕。
translation: It's like a great river that flows for a long time but, in an instant, its banks crumble and its water is filled, and suddenly it's cut off.

source_sentence: 又如猛風吹大雲陣，譬如熱天火燒乾草，譬如旱月煎涸諸泉，譬如雹摧盛春苗稼。
translation: It's like a fierce wind blowing a great cloud formation, like fire burning dry grass on a hot day, like a dry moon drying up springs, or hail destroying a spring crop.

source_sentence: 善子！
translation: Good son!

source_sentence: 我今心亦如是，以為憶念恩愛汝故，心大沸惱，煎燒破碎。
translation: My mind is likewise now. Because I remember the kindness and love I have for you, my heart boils and burns to pieces.

source_sentence: 是故汝且迴還向宮，享受王位，治化天下，於後若見有善惡事，當任汝心，入山求法。」
translation: Therefore, why don't you go back to your palace, enjoy your position as king, and govern the world; later, if you see anything good or bad, you'll let your mind go and enter the mountains to seek the Dharma?"

source_sentence: 佛本行集經卷第二十
translation: Sutra on the Collection of the Past Activities of the Buddha, Volume 20
